title: Sudden rise in game crashes, inability to load game, and unexplainable FPS/PING spikes.
body:
so while the complaints are not in the majority, a good number of people however have been having issues where when the game starts they either can't get into the game at all (aka black loading screen of death), or for some reason they will have fps/ping spikes that are explainable, that can only be repaired by refreshing the game. Some people can't even get into the game at all or just DC all together.

We have a problem with the game, when players are to afraid to play ranked for they have to ask themselves

"is league going to behave today, or am I going to get a unjust timer penalty because the client chose to crash"

I will also say "just use legacy" is not a huge solution either, for legacy itself was already a bad client, that was the whole reason riot spent a year making a new one.

So what are the players stuck with?

Two shitty clients that don't work.

Riot stop making new champions. Stop making new skins.

Get your teams to just make a good client already.

Hire some coders who actually know what they are doing.

replies.body:
Agreed, I have experienced two main things:

First and most frustrating, I go in and get a game, then instead of the loading screen a popup comes up saying my internet connection was lost. Except it wasn't, it works fine. If I hit retry it never works. If I hit cancel and go back to the client, after 10-15 seconds a reconnect button pops up. I hit that are go through this process again, or actually get into the game. This happens about 25% of the time. It's quite annoying. Of the 5 people I frequently play league with 3 others have had this happen, with about the same frequency I do, so it's *not* my environment. 

Second I randomly drop from 60-80 fps to 5-10. This happens also seemingly randomly, though it might be game or champ related because sometimes I'll go 3-5 games without it ever happening, then ill have 2 back to back that have this issue in again seemingly random intervals.

Look I get it's a free game but as a fellow developer making a client that reliably connects to the games is not *that* hard. I did not have either of two issues prior to updating to the beta client. 

Also as a fellow developer I have advice for anyone who works for Rito: write unit tests, write test cases, and actually run regression tests prior to shipping a patch. If you guys want to pay me, I'll even do it for you {{champion:17}}

Hey CleverSloth,

For the connection error where you click cancel, we'll be pushing in a fix shortly (~a small patch should go out today).  This has been affecting a lot of players, and it had a pretty odd user path.  So yay for that fix.

For the fps issue, do you happen to have more info to what you're seeing?  Are you seeing any process hitches for the LeagueClient, or is it strictly game related?

Plus, useless leaver buster can't even filter out if the user had a connection error or intentionally exit (or afk) the game. Have to wait 20 min in order to play 30 min due to server issue is the most frustrating thing ever.

I agree completely. I have had the most unusual errors in game and loading games recently. I am fed up with how slow riot is to resolve these issues. It isn't hard to listen to the the public, and fix these minor  issues. I have no way to submit feedback or glitches. It is beyond acceptable to have a partially working game for weeks. I can`t even open the legacy client. It just refuses to open no matter how many times I re-install League

And I wish they would just fucking get rid of the function that forces you to exit your client whenever you get high ping and/or disconnect from the wifi. I`m tired of relogging every time I get high ping because of the shitty alpha client.
